data.name: XStatusbarController
desc: interface to be implemented by a component offering a more complex user interface to users within a status bar.

A generic status bar field is represented as a simple text field. A status bar controller can be added to a Statusbar and provide information or functions with a more sophisticated user interface.
 A typical example for status bar controller is a zoom chooser. It shows the current zoom and provides general zoom levels on a pop-up menu that can be activated by a mouse action for context menus.

methods.name: click
desc: is called by a status bar if the user clicked with mouse into the field of the corresponding control.

methods.name: command
desc: is called by a status bar if a command event is available for a controller.

methods.name: doubleClick
desc: is called by a status bar if the user double-clicked with mouse into the field of the corresponding control.

methods.name: mouseButtonDown
desc: is called by a status bar if the mouse position is within the controller and a mouse button has been pressed.
If the controller has captured the mouse input this function is also called when the mouse position is not within the controller.

methods.name: mouseButtonUp
desc: is called by a status bar if the mouse position is within the controller and a mouse button has been released.
If the controller has captured the mouse input this function is also called when the mouse position is not within the controller.

methods.name: mouseMove
desc: is called by a status bar if the mouse position is within the controller and a mouse has been moved.
If the controller has captured the mouse input this function is also called when the mouse position is not within the controller.

methods.name: paint
desc: is called by a status bar if the controller has to update the visual representation.
